title: Playing Off Meta in Ranked = Int Feeding ban?
body:
So I recently received this:

https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/383806524465610769/430114459504345088/unknown.png

With links to the following 3 games:
https://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2752255761/91569563?tab=overview
https://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2753199767/91569563?tab=overview
https://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2752013411/91569563?tab=overview

The scores arent so bad and neither are the stats, and 2 out of 3 were wins.
Yes, I played off meta in ranked.

So I contacted support, and they claimed that that I was trolling and griefing, by playing off meta I assume.

https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/102258460338458624/430827294932598795/unknown.png

So first question, it seems that playing off meta in ranked is considered trolling & griefing, but its OK to do in normals? (thats what im reading here ^)

Second question, why don't we have a complete list of which champs can perform which roles, and with which builds? If I can build AD Janna support support and win, why not? If we had a list of all allowed combinations it could avoid this situation for other people, and clarify the rules.

The fact that it took this long for him to be temporarily banned for this should be a huge embarrassment for Riot and a clear sign of a broken system in dire need of fixing. It depends when you get the CS. 
In my off-meta support picks I may let my ADC have all the farm in the laning phase, but once the laning phase is over I'm getting CS as much as anyone else. In the case of Quinn, because by design I transition to a secondary ADC role and/or split pusher. 

A traditional support never achieves that for two reason:
1. They lack waveclear and damage.
2. They have lots of utility, so they don't feel the need to farm for items to be useful. 

If you're an off-meta pick you have both the means and the need to farm later.

Some ADCs cop an attitude because they think they are entitled to all the farm on the map for the entire game, but they aren't thinking in terms of what the overall team comp needs to win - they are just being selfish seeing themselves as the center of the universe and expect the support to be their personal butler for the entire match.

I mean let's just try to be realistic here

In his AD Janna game, he also spent his time on mid lane and has 303 CS at 40 min while his mid laner has 100 CS. Going by your argument of 'it depends on when you get the CS,' when 40 minutes has passed approximately 382 minions has walked down a lane, and if you spend the laning phase being an actual support, it's literally impossible to get 303 CS at 40 min without having taken it from 1-2 players on your team from the beginning of the game.

In his second game as AD Xerath, he has 270 CS at 36 minutes. His mid laner has 50 CS and OP spent almost all of his time on mid lane. As an AD Xerath, you don't have the wave clear or mana to sustain yourself for long, so he has had to last hit with basic attacks.
Even if he started to farm post-laning phase, he wouldn't be able to reach 270 CS at 36 minutes, especially not with a non-scaling kit.

Same with the Malzahar game, 205 CS at 28 min means only 260 minions would hav walked down a lane, and even though Malzahar is a great farmer, it means he has been CS'ing as a support right from the beginning, in his mid laners' lane and possibly in his ADC' lane as well.

It's not that simple, you don't just stay in one lane all game.

>
> There's off-meta, and then there's not even trying to play the assigned role

You could argue that the assigned roles are themselves a meta. The game was never originally built with these roles in mind. People could go duo carry in a lane and it was legit. What if someone decides it would be nice to try a duo mid instead of duo bot?

We see this kind of gameplay in One for All. People don't rage if someone doesn't pick a gold item in their duo lane. People don't rage if someone decides they don't want to play jungle, but want to duo lane instead. People hardly care if you go duo mid instead of duo top or bot. No meta protocol has been established from which people could get angry about yet. 

This is where things get dicey. There is now the expectation that you will conform to a certain formula or be banned. And Riot has done a lot to enforce that formula from the top down. 
It's hard to still legitimately claim you don't force a meta when you're actively banning for it now.

> You could argue that the assigned roles are themselves a meta. The game was never originally built with these roles in mind. People could go duo carry in a lane and it was legit. What if someone decides it would be nice to try a duo mid instead of duo bot?
 
META = Most effective tactics available. Maybe back in season 1 you could do that but since then the game has developed and both the players and RIOT has made it so that the most effective and best to win a game of LoL is to play the current meta(including roles). What do you do in ranked? try your best(at least in my opinion you should) to win the game, and obviously you want to play using the most optimal and highest success rate methods aka the META.

> We see this kind of gameplay in One for All. People don't rage if someone doesn't pick a gold item in their duo lane. People don't rage if someone decides they don't want to play jungle, but want to duo lane instead. People hardly care if you go duo mid instead of duo top or bot. No meta protocol has been established from which people could get angry about yet. 

OFA is a fun mode and you are not held to a standard to try to do your best. YOu start on Lvl.3 now and you get gold, exp and items much faster. You don't  really have to farm, ward, lane or do any other fundamental things to ensure a win, You could 5 man mind from min 1 and it would not be a big deal. That is the point of these RGMs. Its like an off day at your work or school where everyone has a fun time while ranked can be considered a normal work day where you have actual duties and responsibilities.

> This is where things get dicey. There is now the expectation that you will conform to a certain formula or be banned. And Riot has done a lot to enforce that formula from the top down.  It's hard to still legitimately claim you don't force a meta when you're actively banning for it now.

its not really hard at all, pretty simple actually. Everyone likes to spend time with someone that knows how to party and have a fun time but no one wants to work with someone that is always avoiding responsibilities and doesn't really work in the office.
